: APP <-cluster---app-> CLUSTER <-host---cluster-> HOST

clusteraaaip1   and  or cluster.host
{"cluster.name":"aaa"}keyout_id  out_id.@

args:
<%
  {
    ...STATE.authConfigData,
    authConfig: {
      ...STATE.authConfigData.authConfig,
      oauth2: {
        ...EVENT.detail.oauth2,
        expireTime: PIPES.number(
          EVENT.detail.oauth2.expireTime
        ),
      },
      configKey: EVENT.detail.configKey,
      configValuePrefix: EVENT.detail.configValuePrefix,
    },
  }
%>

<%
  {
    authConfig: {
      ...STATE.authConfigData.authConfig,
      basicAuth: {
        ...STATE.authConfigData.authConfig.basicAuth,
        password: EVENT.detail.password ?? "",
        username: EVENT.detail.username ?? "",
      },
      ..._.pick(EVENT.detail, ["configKey"]),
    },
  }
%>

<%
  {
    authConfig: {
      ...STATE.authConfigData.authConfig,
      configPosition: STATE.queryType,
      apiKey: {
        ...STATE.authConfigData.authConfig.apiKey,
        kv: EVENT.detail[STATE.queryType],
      },
    },
  }
%>

functions.name: ellipseText
getConfigListData

processDataWithConfigEnv

en.CONFIRM_INPUT_TO_UNLOCK_TIP: Please confirm and enter below to unlock the confirm button
en.SPECIFY_FIELD_AS_ACCESS_TOKEN: Please specify which field in the response parameters to use as Access Token.
en.AUTO_REFRESH_ACCESS_TOKEN_HINT: The system will determine how often to automatically refresh the Access Token based on the duration setting here; if set to 0, no automatic refresh will occur
en.RETURN_CALCULATED_BASIC_AUTH_PARAMS: Return calculated Basic Auth parameters for API request parameters
en.API_ROUTE_REGEX_TIP: Regular expression to match the routing level of the API contract, e.g., cmdb\..*. Used by API Gateway to distinguish services when forwarding requests.
en.ONE_API_ACCOUNT_ONE_KEY_TIP: An API account can only have one key, accounts that are already assigned will not be in the options
en.SUPPORT_OAUTH2_CLIENT_CREDENTIALS: Supports OAuth2.0 client credentials flow, will return the obtained Access Token value for use as an API request parameter
en.ACCOUNT_NAME_RULE_TPL: 3 to 32 characters, starting with a letter or digit, and can only contain letters, numbers, "_", "-", "."
en.ONE_PER_LINE_FORMAT_METHOD_URI_RATE: One per line, format: METHOD URI rate limit. See example below. Lines with invalid format will be ignored.
en.ACCOUNT_DISABLED_CANNOT_CREATE_KEY: Account is disabled, cannot create key
en.CONFIRM_INPUT_DELETE_BELOW_TO_UNLOCK: Please confirm and enter Delete below to unlock the confirm button
en.RETURN_CALCULATED_BASIC_AUTH: Will return the calculated Basic Auth parameter for use in API requests
en.UPDATE_CONTENT: After update, please inform external programs to replace the old key; otherwise, errors will occur. This operation cannot be undone. Confirm and enter Update below to unlock the confirm button
en.DELETE_CONTENT: After deletion, if an external program is still using this key, an error will occur. This action cannot be undone. Please confirm and enter Delete below to unlock the confirm button
en.DEFINE_VARIABLE_USING_COLON_TIP: You can define variables using colons, such as /api/:your-var/user
en.INVALID_DATA_FORMAT_ABORT_REGISTRATION: Invalid data format, registration aborted. Please check and correct before importing!
en.NAME_SUGGESTION_TPL: We recommend naming it {layout}.{appName}. Optional layouts: logic for logical services, db for database services, web for web services. For example: logic.cmdb, db.mysql
en.SUPPORT_OAUTH2_CLIENT_CREDENTIALS_RETURN: Support OAuth2.0 client credentials grant, return acquired Access Token for API request use
en.PREFIX_FORMAT_RULE: Contains numbers, letters, underscores, and hyphens, with a length of 3 to 30 characters
en.EXPIRE_TIME_CANNOT_BE_LESS_THAN_0: Expire time cannot be less than 0
en.EXTERNAL_ACCESS_SERVICE_TIP: When accessing the service interface externally, use this prefix as the first-level URI, then append the actual URI. For example: if the service request prefix is cmdb-service and the URI is /api/user, the full URI for external access is /cmdb-service/api/user
en.SEND_REQUEST_TO_ACCESS_TOKEN_URL_AND_RET: Send request to Access Token URL and return parameter list. Click
en.DISABLED_CONTENT: After disabling, if any external program still uses this key, an error will occur. You can re-enable it to restore!
en.PARTIAL_REGISTRATION_FAILURE_TPL: Partial registration failed, created {{insertCount}}, updated {{updateCount}}, failed {{failedCount}}
en.ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_TIME_REQUIRED: Access token expire time is required
en.FUNCTION_DESCRIPTION:
## 1. Function Description
API Gateway provides companies with a unified API access gateway, thereby offering a unified:

* Name service

* Authentication service

* Rate limiting control

* Load balancing

* Circuit breaking mechanism

* Permission management

* Node health monitoring

* Interface monitoring


## 2. Register Service

Please first register the service through the UI and configure its request prefix (varies by service, used to differentiate services).

> Request Prefix Explanation
> When externally accessing service interfaces, use this prefix as the first-level URI, then append the actual URI. For example: if the service request prefix is `cmdb-service` and the URI is `/api/user`, the full external access URI will be `/cmdb-service/api/user`.

## 3. Register Nodes

Register backend node IP + PORT, and configure forwarding weights. During actual requests, API Gateway will use a weighted round-robin algorithm to select backend nodes.

## 4. Invocation Method

Currently, we support OpenAPI authentication. You can click to copy the encapsulated SDK. The OpenAPI keys (`ACCESS_KEY`, `SECRET_KEY`) can be obtained from [Key Management](/next/api-gateway/keys).
en.FORWARD_PREFIX_DESCRIPTION: When the gateway forwards a service interface, it prepends the forward prefix to the request URI to accommodate differences of the same service interface across environments. For example: if the service request URI is /api/user and the forward prefix is prod/v1, the complete URI actually forwarded to the backend node is /prod/v1/api/user
en.AUTO_REFRESH_ACCESS_TOKEN_TIP: The system will determine the frequency of automatic Access Token refresh based on the duration setting here; if set to 0, no automatic refresh will occur.
en.RETURN_CALCULATED_BASIC_AUTH_FOR_API: Return calculated Basic Auth parameter for API request use
en.CONFIRM_INPUT_DELETE_TO_UNLOCK: Please confirm and enter Delete below to unlock the confirm button
en.REGISTER_TO_SERVICE_REGISTRY: Name used to register to the service registry, for example: logic.cmdb
en.CONFIRM_INPUT_TO_UNLOCK: Please confirm and enter below to unlock the confirm button
en.RATE_LIMITING_MUST_BE_NON_NEGATIVE: Rate limiting: Integer and >= 0; if 0, no requests are allowed
en.CONFIGURE_AUTHENTICATION_METHOD_FOR_API_: Configure authentication method for API requests
en.ONE_API_ACCOUNT_ONE_KEY: An API account can only have one key, accounts that have already been assigned will not be in the options
en.SEND_REQUEST_TO_ACCESS_TOKEN_URL_AND_RET: Send request to Access Token URL and return parameter list
en.WEIGHT_STATUS_PROTOCOL_NOT_EFFECTIVE_PLE: Weight, status and protocol are not effective, please edit in individual edit
en.NAME_CHARACTER_LIMIT: Can contain numbers, letters, underscores, hyphens, and dots, with a length of 3 to 80 characters
en.VERSION_NUMBER_CANNOT_REPEAT: Version number cannot repeat with historical version number
en.PLEASE_ENTER_ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_TIME: Please enter access token expire time
en.SELECT_USER_DESCRIPTION: A user can only have one key, users who have been assigned will be excluded from the drop-down box
en.VERSION_DUPLICATED_USE_ANOTHER: Version duplicated, please use another version
en.CONFIRM_TO_UNLOCK_TPL: Please confirm and enter {{ip}}:{{port}} below to unlock the confirm button
en.CONFIRM_AND_ENTER_TPL: Please confirm and enter {{count}} below to unlock the confirm button
en.NOTE_ENABLE_API_ACCOUNT: Note: Enabling API account will also enable the Key!
en.RETURN_ACCESS_TOKEN_FOR_API: Return the obtained Access Token value for use as an API request parameter
en.CONFIRM_AND_INPUT_NAME_TO_UNLOCK_TPL: Please confirm and enter {{name}} below to unlock the confirm button
en.ENABLED_CONTENT: After enabling, the key will be restored to active!
en.METHOD_MUST_BE_POST_GET_PUT_DELETE_HEAD_: Method: Only POST, GET, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, PATCH, OPTIONS are allowed
en.NAME: Name
en.NOTE_DISABLE_KEY_EXTERNAL_PROGRAM_ERROR: Note: After disabling the key, if an external program uses this key, it will cause an error!
en.CREATOR: Creator
en.ONE_PER_LINE_FORMAT_AS_FOLLOWS: One per line, format: METHOD URI rate limit. See example below. Invalid entries will be ignored.
en.PLEASE_ENTER_ACCESS_TOKEN_VALUE: Please enter the Access Token value

transform.dataSource:
<%
  {
    page: DATA.page,
    pageSize: DATA.page_size,
    total: DATA.total,
    list: DATA.list.map((item) => ({
      ...item,
      icon: item.runtime
        ? {
            lib: "easyops",
            category: "model",
            icon: item.runtime,
            color: item.isOpenAPI ? "green" : "gray",
          }
        : item.language
        ? {
            lib: "easyops",
            category: "program-language",
            icon: item.language || "question-circle",
            color: item.isOpenAPI ? "green" : "gray",
          }
        : {
            lib: "fa",
            category: "fas",
            icon: "question-circle",
            color: item.isOpenAPI ? "green" : "gray",
          },
    })),
  }
%>

args:
<% _.chain(EVENT.detail.apis.trim().split("\n"))
  .filter()
  .map(row => row.trim().split(/\s+/g))
  .filter(row => row.length === 3 && row[1].startsWith("/"))
  .map(row => ({
    method: row[0].toUpperCase(),
    route: row[1],
    name: row[0] + ":" + row[1],
    frequency: Math.round(Number(row[2])),
    service: [{instanceId: PATH.serviceId}],
    isOpenAPI: EVENT.detail.isOpenAPI
  }))
  .filter(row => row.frequency >= 0  && 
    ["GET", "POST", "PUT", "DELETE", "OPTIONS", "HEAD", "PATCH"].includes(row.method)
  )
  .value()
%>
<% I18N("REGISTRATION_SUCCESS_TPL", { insertCount: EVENT.detail.insert_count, updateCount: EVENT.detail.update_count, failedCount: EVENT.detail.failed_count }) %>
<% I18N("PARTIAL_REGISTRATION_FAILURE_TPL", { insertCount: EVENT.detail.insert_count, updateCount: EVENT.detail.update_count, failedCount: EVENT.detail.failed_count }) %>

<%
  {
    ...EVENT.detail,

    name: EVENT.detail.name,
    runtime: EVENT.detail.runtime || "",
    language: EVENT.detail.language || "",
  }
%>

<%
  {
    ...EVENT.detail,
    name1: EVENT.detail.name.endsWith("." + SYS.org)
      ? EVENT.detail.name.substring(
          0,
          EVENT.detail.name.length -
            String(SYS.org).length -
            1
        )
      : EVENT.detail.name,
    name: EVENT.detail.name,
  }
%>

<% _.chain(EVENT.detail.apis.trim().split("\n"))
  .filter()
  .map(row => row.trim().split(/\s+/g))
  .filter(row => row.length === 3 && row[1].startsWith("/"))
  .map(row => ({
    method: row[0].toUpperCase(),
    route: row[1],
    name: row[0] + ":" + row[1],
    frequency: Math.round(Number(row[2])),
    service: [{instanceId: PATH.serviceId}],
    isOpenAPI: EVENT.detail.isOpenAPI
  }))
  .filter(row => row.frequency >= 0  && 
    ["GET", "POST", "PUT", "DELETE", "OPTIONS", "HEAD", "PATCH"].includes(row.method)
  )
  .value()
%>
<% I18N("REGISTRATION_SUCCESS_TPL", { insertCount: EVENT.detail.insert_count, updateCount: EVENT.detail.update_count, failedCount: EVENT.detail.failed_count }) %>
<% I18N("PARTIAL_REGISTRATION_FAILURE_TPL", { insertCount: EVENT.detail.insert_count, updateCount: EVENT.detail.update_count, failedCount: EVENT.detail.failed_count }) %>

context.value:
<%
  {
    page: CTX.accountList.page,
    page_size: CTX.accountList.page_size,
    total: CTX.accountList.total,
    list: CTX.accountList.list.map((i) => ({
      ...i,
      newSwitchUsers: i.switchUsers?.map(
        (u) =>
          CTX.userGroupIdMap?.[u]?.name ||
          CTX.userIdMap?.[u]?.name
      ),
    })),
  }
%>
context.name: newAccountData
